Mr/Mrs XXX, to confirm that you have concluded an agreement with SBIB in respect of [insert] [policy] provided to you by the [Insurer]:

Do you authorise SBIB to debit the [R xxx amount payable] under the policy agreement from your bank account, on xxxx_ day of every [month, year]? 
 
The Collection Amount may change depending on what is set out in the policy.  This includes if there are any endorsements as set out in the Policy Schedule, annual increases in benefits and/or where you request changes to your policy.

The Collection Amount will carry a STATEMENT REFERENCE NUMBER which is SBIB’s short name plus your policy number.  This will help you to identify the Collection Amount on your bank statement.

If the Collection Date falls on a non-processing day (Sunday or public holiday), you agree that the Collection Amount may be debited against the Bank Account on the first business day thereafter.

If there is not enough money in your Bank Account on the Collection Date, SBIB will track the Bank Account (at no cost to you) and debit the Collection Amount on another day when there is money in your Bank Account. 
 
Where the debit of the Collection Amount is successful on more than two consecutive occasions on a date other than your selected date, your Collection Date will automatically default to the successful date.  
 
If SBIB cannot debit the Collection Amount for any reason, you understand that your insurance cover may be impacted, and that you may pay bank charges related to this Debit Order Mandate.

NB: SBIB will amend their mandate and (customer) will receive an SMS notifying them that the Debit Order on their account has been amended. 
 
The Collection Amount will continue to be debited from your Bank Account under this Debit Order Mandate until you cancel; or the INSURER cancels your Policy; or until you cancel this Debit Order Mandate by giving us [SBIB] 30 days written notice. You understand that if you cancel the authority to debit your bank account, your insurance policy will be cancelled, and all benefits will cease?                                         

Mr/Mrs ______do you understand and accept what I have shared with you? Yes/No

I need you to please understand the following constraints should you decide to proceed with our cover: 
• Due to the limited information received during this call, the appropriateness of the advice I provided to you may be limited; and 
• I urge you to please consider on your own, whether the advice provided is appropriate, considering your objectives, financial situation and particular needs. Do you understand?

Policies that incepted on 01/07/2017 and thereafter, commission is 20%.

This policy may be amended or cancelled at any time for any reason whatsoever, by SBIB giving you 31 days’ notice in writing using the latest contact details we have on record at the time of cancellation.
The insurer can discontinue your insurance policy with 31 days’ written notice at your email or postal address on record.
You may also cancel this policy by giving us notice of such cancellation. The insurer will be entitled to retain the minimum premium for the period of the policy.

This policy has a 31 day cooling off period. This means that if this cover does not suite your needs, you may
cancel it within 31 days of having taken out this policy or made any changes to this policy. We will refund all
your premiums you have paid within the cooling off period back to you, provided you have not claimed or
submitted any claims during this period. If you do not cancel within the cooling off period, you will be bound to

Market Conduct Table.phrase: (HOC) Provide the customer with the Sum Insured ( Upon request from the customer) , Explain under and over insurance to the customer and the consequences.
Probe/capture quantity of geyser. For example, 1 geyser, Probe/capture type of geyser. For example, Electric geyser
Basic excess 1250

Burst or leaking geyser (normal) 1250
Resultant Damages 500
Burst or leaking geyser (solar)
Resultant Damages
R1 250 per solar collector tube and
R1 250 per water collector tank and
R500

Subsidence and landslip
5% of claim, minimum R2500

Mining Operations
1% of sum insured, minimum R2500

Electronic equipment
10% of claim, minimum R1 250

Unoccupied more than 30days/malicious damage/theft/attempted-Additional R5000. Our liability would be limited to 30% of sum insured at the time of loss
Please also note that your home should always be well maintained.

Your policy will be reviewed every year, by the underwriter, to ensure that both your sum insured and premium are in line with the increasing costs of replacement. This is done to avoid claims issues (like short falls), relating to incorrect sums insured.
Please remember that you need to notify Standard Bank Insurance Brokers of any material changes to the risk insured. Failure to do so could result in your claim being repudiated.

Please make sure that you advise SBIB of any change in your banking details, as failure to do this could result in your premiums not being collected and your cover ceasing. In the event two months premiums have not been collect your policy will cancel which further means that your cover will cease.
Was the client advised of correct premiums?

This is applicable to the amendment of information regarding the property Insured such as Roof type, Sum Insured etc.. Any change that will result in a material loss and/or customer complaint if not updated by the Agent.

Notes to reference the call: Make notes regarding call backs made to client, referral feedback, information that cannot be amended or captured elsewhere, etc.Did you add accurate notes on event log (quality of notes) i.e what the query is all about and what you advised?
Did the consultant acknowledged and addressed appropriately. Do not automatically revert to a different language without obtaining the customers understanding and consent to change.

Never speak faster or slower than the client, always match their pace
If you are struggling to hear the customer let him know rather than trying to assume what he is saying.
Remember it is important for the customer to hear and understand everything you are saying

Provide a summary of the Insured events/ Benefits ( Must be specific to the call type, especially when Retaining)                                                                                                                                                                                           Provide the product information:-
This policy will provide you and your family with the assurance that your new home will be protected in the unlikely event of damage due to an insured risk. Standard Insurance Limited will provide you with much needed assistance to either repair, replace or restore your home to its original state before the event. If your house is uninhabitable, Standard Insurance Limited will assist you to find alternative accommodation during the time that your house is being repaired.

List nature and extent of benefits to be provided
I am now going to take you through the cover benefits, exclusions and excesses. Please take careful note of these and ask me if you have any questions.
This policy covers the structure of your home against damage, fire, accidents and natural disasters. This means you will be covered in the event of:
Fire
Lighting
Storm, wind, Hail, Snow & Flood
Burst or Leaking Pipes or Geysers
Resultant Damages
Theft & Attempted Theft
Accidental Damage to Fixed glass, Mirrors & Sanitary ware.
Impact Damage
Limited Subsidence and Landslip

In addition to the comprehensive cover I’ve just told you about, we also provide you with home assistance 24 hours a day 7 days a week. This assistance benefit gives you the following:
• Core Home Care Services, which include locksmiths, electricians, pest control services at no cost to you for the call-out fee and first hour of labor.
• White appliance repairs, like stoves, washing machines & microwaves. Also, at no cost to you for the call-out fee and first hour of labor.                                                                                                                                                                                                                    This benefit is limited to 2 claims per year.

Your policy has certain exclusions that I need to explain to you. And when you
receive your policy documentation you must please read the section on exclusions.
very carefully so that you understand what is not covered by this policy. Some of the important exclusions are:
We do not cover any loss or damage that is not defined in the policy
We do not cover any loss or damage as a result of the building not being maintained.
We do not cover any loss or damage that is as a result of defective workmanship or where the building has not been built according to national and municipal standards.
We do not cover any pre –existing damages or defects.
We do not cover the matching of materials.

Grid Failure/Interruption Definition:
Means an unintentional total or partial interruption, interference or suspension of electricity supply or an electricity outage, whether by an electricity cut, electricity failure, electricity blackout, electricity loss, or an absolute blackout due to the collapse, fault, failure, neglect, damage, inability or any other cause whatsoever (inclusive of any Government action) of any electricity provider or Electricity Supplier to produce, connect, supply, transmit or distribute electricity to the Insured or anyone else.

Process Table.phrase: Please confirm or add email address

Does the customer give consent to the bank carrying out identity and fraud check prevention checks and sharing information relating to this application through the South African Fraud Prevention Service?
Was the query resolved at First Contact and not handed off?

Did the consultant handle objections effectively (handled 2 objections minimum) when trying to retain the customer?Did the consultant use the correct retention tools in trying to retain the clients i.e. downgrade, etc?Did the consultant deal with and overcome the objection?
Was system error escalated to IT ?

Customer Experience Table.phrase: Give reason why client will be placed on hold
Actively paying attention to the customer throughout the call and comprehending what the customer is saying
Always be available at all time to speak to client (Inbound or Outbound)
customer name X2 in an average call
accountability, resolution etc.Do as promised to the client (e'g Call back client as promised)
Appropriately used empathy for the customer’s situation and acknowledged the customers high's and lows
Ask client if they can be further assisted before putting the phone down.
Do not be rude to client or get irritated

POSITIONING OF THE SURVEY TO CUSTOMERS“Thank you for your call we would really appreciate a few minutes of your time to complete a quick survey. There are only 3 questions on the survey regarding your experience on this call.” May I proceed to transfer you to the survey?
Display high professional standard of conduct (Eating, chewing, speaking over the customer) Speak clearly, use simple words and phrases, don’t use overly complex vocabulary. Avoid slang.
Did the consultant end the call appropriately or shared a positive statement.

Adherence to REP Status:           Consultants should only discuss products that they are accredited for in line with their Fit and Proper status. (e.g. Serving on  Advice however only accredited on intermediary or discuss product not accredited for)   Misleading or Misrepresenting can include things like:- giving  incorrect  information about the product.- giving the wrong advice about what product would be best for the client.- exaggerating what the product can do in comparison  to other products( Advise)- keeping important information about the product or service hidden or obscured advising the customer that the product is compulsory when it is optional when they want to cancel.

SBIB as an accountable institution in terms of the Financial Intelligence Centre Act, is required to conduct sanctions screening on all policyholders, beneficiaries and other parties involved with this policy. SBIB has the right to immediately terminate the relationship with you or refuse to pay out any proceeds of the policy, should SBIB suspect or become aware that you, a beneficiary or any other party involved with the policy is a sanctioned person or entity.

As part of our service, Standard Bank of South Africa Limited would like to provide you with information on products and services offered by the group and other companies, which we believe may benefit you. Because we regard your personal information as confidential, we need your consent to share it with the group. The group means our affiliates, associates, subsidiaries and divisions together with our holding company.

Do you consent to:
Us Marketing our products, services and special offers to you?
Do you consent: Us communicating other companies' products, services and special offers to you. If you respond positively to such communication, you may be contacted by that company?
Do you consent: Us sharing your personal information within the group for marketing purposes and the group then marketing its products, services and special offers to you?
Do you consent: Us contacting you for research purposes (the research companies we use follow strict code of conduct and treat customer information confidentially)?

Mr/Mrs XXX, to confirm that you have concluded an agreement with SBIB in respect of [insert] [policy] provided to you by the Liberty Group: Do you authorise SBIB to debit the [R xxx amount payable] under the policy agreement from your bank account? The Collection Amount may change depending on what is set out in the policy. This includes if there are any endorsements as set out in the Policy Schedule, annual increases in your premiums, benefits and/or where you request changes to your policy. SBIB will debit the Collection Amount on xxxx_ day and thereafter on the _____xxx day of every [month, year], or on another day when you have funds in your Bank Account. The Collection Amount will carry a STATEMENT REFERENCE NUMBER which is SBIB’s short name plus your policy number (mention FUN/TMA Policy number). This will be provided to you before the first Collection Date. This will help you to identify the Collection Amount on your bank statement. If the Collection Date falls on a non-processing day (Sunday or public holiday), you agree that the Collection Amount may be debited against the Bank Account on the first business day prior/before. If there is not enough money in your Bank Account on the Collection Date, SBIB will track the Bank Account (at no cost to you) and debit the Collection Amount on another day when there is money in your Bank Account. Where the debit of the Collection Amount is successful on more than two consecutive occasions on a date other than your selected date, your Collection Date will automatically default to the successful date. If SBIB cannot debit the Collection Amount for any reason, you understand that your insurance cover may be impacted, and that you may pay bank charges related to this Debit Order Mandate. The total amount that is collected under this Debit Order Mandate will never be more than the MAXIMUM Payment amount. The Collection Amount will continue to be debited from your Bank Account under this Debit Order Mandate until you cancel; or the INSURER cancels your Policy; or until you cancel this Debit Order Mandate by giving us [SBIB] 30 days written notice. You understand that if you cancel the authority to debit your bank account, your insurance policy will be cancelled, and all benefits will cease. Do you confirm that you understand and agree to the terms of this Debit Order Mandate? IF SBSA BANK CUSTOMER THEN: - As a SBSA customer SBIB will AUTHENTICATE this debit order on your behalf. [INSERT INITIALS+SURNAMEOF POLICYHOLDER] you will receive an SMS notifying you that SBIB has setup a debit order on your bank account. This will be followed by a second SMS informing you that SBIB has authenticated this mandate on your behalf. IF NON-BANK CUSTOMER, THEN: - [INSERT INITIALS+SURNAMEOF POLLICYHOLDER], you will receive an SMS notifying you that SBIB has setup a debit order on your bank account. YOU MUST authenticate this debit order mandate in order for SBIB to conclude the debit order mandate. BOTH SBSA BANK AND NON-BANK: If the authentication is not received for some reason, then SBIB will attempt to electronically collect the premium to ensure you remain under cover. consultant. * Where the customer doesn’t know their banking details –Consultant must get permission from the customer to use banking details on standard bank systems in order to proceed.

Funeral Benefits per policy per life.

Automatic Benefit Increase which means that you have the option to have your cover amount automatically increase annually to keep up with increasing burial expenses. The Cashback benefit starts from the time it is added to the policy and pays 10% of the total policy premiums that was received back to the customer within a 5-
year cycle Grocery benefit of up to R24 000. This benefit provides a set amount paid monthly for the purpose of the cost of groceries for the family when the Policyholder or Spouse dies. Memorial benefit of up to R20 000, This benefit is paid in addition to the Funeral benefit because we know how costly a Funeral really is Catering benefit of up to R20 000, The Catering benefit will pay-out when the Policyholder or Spouse dies. We know at Funerals that there are lots of mouths to feed, so we have included this for you! Airtime Benefit of up to R1000, The Airtime benefit is meant to assist the family with cell phone airtime in order to contact relatives and make arrangements for the funeral. Repatriation of up to R25 000, This benefit is paid in addition to the Funeral benefit because we know how costly transport costs can be. These benefits are only payable if the Funeral claim is accepted as a valid claim as per the Terms and Conditions of this policy.The policy must have been in force for the required waiting period of six (6) months 
and all monthly premiums paid in full. There is no waiting period if the claim is caused by an accidental cause

If the main member or spouse dies from unnatural causes, then the funeral benefit is doubled. Should the Principal Life Assured die, the remaining family members on the policy will remain covered for a further 6 months and no premiums will be payable. An existing member of the policy will need to contact SBIB Servicing to request continuation of policy otherwise policy will cancel.

Your policy will carry the following restrictions and waiting periods in terms of the cover you have selected today:
The waiting period from the policy start is 6 months (with 6 premiums needing to be paid) for natural causes of death before a claim will be paid. Accidental death is covered immediately upon collection of the first premium. The policy does not cover any claims for suicide for the first 12 months (and 12 premiums also must have been paid).To qualify for the Premium Waiver benefit to be paid, the policy must have been active for 6 months, with at least 6 premiums being paid.

Please confirm if this policy is being purchased with the intention to replace or cancel another existing policy? If answer is Yes, then the following must be read:
If you are replacing any insurance product, this may come with risks, for example new waiting period or exclusions or different benefits or lives insured. Please ensure that you read through the terms and conditions before cancelling your other product If a policyholder/ main insured provides evidence of current cover along with a cancellation letter from their existing insurer – Standard Bank will assess any claim as if cover was continuous and any new waiting period will only apply to cover in excess of the replaced policy OR if the life insured not previously covered

Claims are paid within 48 hours provided that all relevant documentation has been received and your claim has been approved. Your claim must be submitted within 12 months from the date of death of the insured person. The documents required to claim are mentioned in the terms and conditions. You may claim at any Standard Bank branch or by contacting our claims contact center - 0860 123 999 (Option 3) Claims for stillborn babies are limited to 2.

We do not cover accidental death as a result of any insured person’s direct involvement in any illegal or criminal acts. We do not cover claims for insured members who are older than 18 and who do not have an ID .NO Benefits will be paid during the waiting period. If any Life insured dies due to natural causes during the waiting period, Standard Bank will refund the premiums paid for that particular life insured.

Mr/Mrs _______________. In the event of the death of any member, the benefit is paid to the main member, however in the event of the death of the main member; the benefit is paid to a nominated beneficiary. The nominated beneficiary must be over the age of 18 years and must have a relationship with you (for example a family member). The nominated beneficiary is the person who you would want the money to be paid to in the event of your death. This may be amended at a later stage by contacting our customer services department. however, we encourage you to provide us with details as soon as possible to avoid delays when there is a claim.Up to 5 beneficiaries can be added on a Policy.Capture the details of the beneficiary.
Accurate capturing of the information provided which includes personal details and product related information.
Market Conduct Table.category: Accuracy Capturing Service Request on Core System

Market Conduct Table.phrase: Notes to reference the call: Make notes regarding call backs made to client, referral feedback, information that cannot be amended or captured elsewhere. Did you add accurate notes on Sapphire/Maven (3rd party policies, migration, 1st/2nd call etc)

Did the consultant acknowledge and addressed the client appropriately? All calls should be conducted in our business language (English) unless customer request to switch. Ask permission to speak in customers preferred language if struggling with English.

Never speak faster or slower than the client, always match their pace
If you are struggling to hear the customer let them know rather than trying to assume what they are saying. Remember it is important for the customer to hear and understand everything you are saying.

Regulatory Table.phrase:
"Inbound Call:
Thank you for calling Standard Bank Insurance Brokers/Limited, you through to Complaints department, ………………. speaking, how may I assist you?
Outbound Call:
Good day may I please speak to MR/S…………. My name is ………….and I’m calling from Standard Bank Insurance Brokers/Limited, Complaints department"
Is it an appropriate/convenient time to talk?

This call is being monitored and recorded for record-keeping, quality-assurance and security purposes. A copy of this call can be made available to you at your request. Do you understand and confirm that you are comfortable with this?
To ensure that I am speaking to the right person and to protect the security of your information. I will ask you a few questions (NB: questions noted under process)

Market Conduct Table.phrase: Follow up and set reminders (where applicable) to resolve the query
Apologize when issue cannot be resolved on the current call and clearly outline next steps for the customer to take
The correct actions must be taken in order to fulfil the complaint
Advised customer of relevant turn around times (query to be service investigated or service provider information)
Advised the customer how he/she will receive feedback to their query
Correct and accurate information must be provided to the customer
Requested clear and accurate information relating to the query/Providing alternative solutions when applicable?
Did the consultant update accurate notes for record keeping?
Pace of the call appropriate [did not sound rushed]?
Did the consultant display empathy?
Did the consultant acknowledge language barrier?

Process Table.phrase: Do you have an email address
What is your risk and postal address?
Managing internal stakeholders proactively and effectively to resolve a query or complain. (e.g. Admin , Stansure and Refunds)?
Provides an explanation on the policy wording if required, when upholding a rejection

Regulatory Table.phrase:
Good day, may I speak to Mr/Mrs…
My name is __________ and I ‘m calling you today from Standard Bank Insurance Brokers from Standard Bank Group.I am calling you today to tell you more about the exciting Standard Bank Flexible Life Plan, underwritten by Liberty Group Limited.
Is this a convenient time to talk to you?

Please note that all our calls are recorded for monitoring and record purposes. A copy of this recording can be made available to you on your request                                                               Please confirm if we may proceed?

Please note that I am an employee of SBIB who is mandated by Liberty Group Limited to sell this product and I am a fully qualified representative. and SBIB accepts the responsibility for the intermediary services rendered by me. SBIB is an authorised financial services provider. This product is regarded as Long-Term Category B and SBIB is authorised for this category. SBIB has a written mandate to act on behalf of Liberty and has professional indemnity and fidelity insurance cover in place. I need to inform you that I am calling you from Standard Bank Insurance Brokers, also known as SBIB (our FSP number is 224) and I am authorised in terms of a written mandate to render intermediary services for SBIB. Please note that I am an employee of SBIB who is mandated by Liberty Group Limited to sell this product and I offer financial services under supervision. and SBIB accepts responsibility for any intermediary services rendered by me.

I will now ask you for personal information. This information will be used to 
administer your policy, assess claims and other related functions. Your information will be shared within the Standard Bank Group. For details on how your information will be used, stored and shared kindly refer to your policy documentation when you receive them.Are you comfortable that we proceed? Yes/No

SBIB as an accountable institution in terms of the Financial Intelligence Centre Act, is required to conduct sanctions screening on all policyholders, beneficiaries and other parties involved with this policy. SBIB has the right to immediately terminate the relationship with you or refuse to pay out any proceeds of the policy, should SBIB suspect or become aware that you, a beneficiary or any other party involved with the policy is a sanctioned person or entity.

As part of our service, Standard Bank of South Africa Limited would like to provide you with information on products and services offered by the group and other companies, which we believe may benefit you. Because we regard your personal information as confidential, we need your consent to share it with the group. The group means our affiliates, associates, subsidiaries and divisions together with our holding company.

Do you consent to:
1. Us Marketing our products, services and special offers to you?
2. Us communicating other companies' products, services and special offers to you. If you respond positively to such communication, you may be contacted by that company?
3. Us sharing your personal information within the group for marketing purposes and the group then marketing its products, services and special offers to you.
4. Us contacting you for research purposes (the research companies we use follow strict code of conduct and treat customer information confidentially)?

Liberty does not guarantee premium rates and reviews them at least once each year.  
Mr/Mrs XXX, for the debit order to come off your Standard Bank account please confirm the last four digits of your account number with me?      
NB: The agent must not give the last four digits of the bank account to the customer – the customer must read their last four to agents on the recorded line                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  Mr/Mrs XXX, SBIB, will AUTHENTICATE this debit order on your behalf. You will receive an SMS notifying you that a debit order has been setup on your bank account for this policy
Mr/Mrs XXX, you will receive an SMS from your bank notifying you that SBIB, has setup a debit order on your bank account. You MUST authenticate this debit order mandate for the premiums to be collected for this policy
Mr/Mrs XXX, to confirm that you have concluded an agreement with SBIB in respect of FLEXIBLE LIFE [insert] [policy] provided to you by the LIBERTY GROUP. Do you authorise SBIB to debit the [R [xxx amount payable] under the policy agreement from your bank account? If applicable, the first Collection Amount may include additional fees or charges. The Collection Amount may change depending on what is set out in the policy. This includes if there are any endorsements as set out in the Policy Schedule, annual increases in benefits and/or where you request changes to your policy. SBIB will debit the Collection Amount on xxxx_ day and thereafter on the xxxx_ day of every MONTHLY, or on another day when there is money in your Bank Account. The Collection Amount will carry a Statement Reference Number which is SBIB’s short name plus your policy number. This will be provided to you before the first Collection Date. This will help you to identify the Collection Amount on your bank statement. If the Collection Date falls on a non-processing day (Sunday or public holiday), you agree that the Collection Amount may be debited against the Bank Account on the first business day before/prior. If there is not enough money in your Bank Account on the Collection Date, SBIB may track the Bank Account (at no cost to you) and debit the Collection Amount on another day when there is money in your Bank Account. Where the debit of the Collection Amount is successful on more than two consecutive occasions on a date other than your selected date, your Collection Date may default to the successful date. If SBIB cannot debit the Collection Amount for any reason, you understand that your insurance cover may be impacted, and that you may pay for bank charges related to this Debit Order Mandate. The total amount that is collected under this Debit Order Mandate may not be more than the Maximum Payment amount. The annual adjustment rate will not be more than half the premium payment. The Collection Amount will continue to be debited from your Bank Account under this Debit Order Mandate until you cancel; or the Insurer cancels your Policy or until you cancel this Debit Order Mandate by giving us (SBIB) 30 days written notice. You understand that if you cancel the authority to debit your bank account, your insurance policy will be cancelled, and all benefits will cease. If the authentication is not received for some reason, then SBIB will attempt to electronically collect the premium to ensure you remain under cover. Do you confirm that you understand and agree to the terms of this Debit Order Mandate?
Mr/Ms …. - SBIB earns 3.25% commission on the premium
SBIB holds a binder agreement and therefore earns a binder fee of up to 7.50% from Liberty Group. Both the commission and binder fee already form part of the quoted premium

You will be sent an obligatory disclosure and statutory notice which outlines important information as well as the terms and conditions which you will need to understand. You have an obligation to read this - please contact us should you not receive that within the next 31 
days. <Customer name>, please note that your policy documents will be sent to you via SMS – you will need to use the first 6 digits of your ID number to access the documents. Should you not receive this SMS within the next 31 days – please let us know and we will resend them to you.

Please note that Liberty and their compliance officer can be contacted on 0860 456 789. SBIB supports the OMBUDSMAN for long term insurance as well as the FAIS Ombud and subscribes to the Standard Bank complaints procedure.
Details of that will also be included in the documentation along with contact details of SBIB and our compliance officer.Our compliance officer can be contacted at 
Complaint.ResolutionCentre@standardbank.co.za
Telephone: 0860 101 101
Please also note that our Help Desk and Claims departments can be reached on 0860 123 999.

Liberty as the underwriter can discontinue your insurance policy with 31 days’ written notice at your email or postal address on record. You may also cancel this policy by giving us notice of such cancellation. Do you confirm that you understand and accept the cancellation rights for any valid reason by yourself and Liberty?

Your policy includes a cooling off period of 31 days. After the cooling off period, you must provide us with 31 days’ notice to cancel the policy. Cooling off applies to new policies or changes (excluding administrative changes), made to this policy
Mr/Mrs ___________Please confirm that we have not asked you or forced you to waive any of your rights or benefits on this policy? Yes/No

This policy only covers people who live in South Africa permanently OR People who live in South Africa for at least 9 months of the year OR People who work in South Africa and have a legal working permit valid for at least 6 months.

Market Conduct Table.phrase: <Client name>, cover on this policy starts from a minimum of R50 000 up to a maximum of R500 000 and there are various options for you to choose from in R500 incremental benefit levels. What cover amount would you like me to quote you for? Cover amount confirmation: <Client name>, are you happy for us to proceed and arrange the (cover amount of RXX) life insurance for you? Customer must answer Yes to confirm the sum insured amount. If spouse cover wanted and is eligible: What cover amount would you like me to quote you for your spouse? Cover amount confirmation: <Client name>, are you happy for us to proceed and arrange the  (cover amount of RXX) life insurance for your spouse? Customer must answer Yes to confirm the sum insured amount

Optional Automatic Benefit Increase which means that you have the option to have your cover amount automatically increased annually to keep up with increasing inflation,in order to keep up with annual inflation and to ensure that your beneficiaries are taken care of when you can’t provide for them is that you can choose whether or not you would like your benefits to increase annually. You have the option to select this increase to be set at 5% or 10% depending on your preference – or you can choose not to have your benefits increase at all – and this will mean that your cover will remain at RXXXXX (Sum insured chosen by the customer). An additional annual premium increase will apply if you select this option and you can stop this benefit if you wish. Optional Cashback benefit – you have the option to choose a cashback option –which means that should you choose this benefit; you will receive a percentage of your premiums paid back to you every 5 years (an additional premium applies if you add this benefit).  The Flexible Life Plan product also has the option of a CashBack benefit – which allows you choose whether you would like to receive a percentage (currently 10%) of your premiums collected, every 5 years – provided your policy premiums are up to date. Can I include a Cashback option for you, <Client name>?

Accidental Death benefit which is paid out after a policy is activated despite the waiting period, which means that should you pass away because of an accident – your beneficiary will receive your life cover payout as well as an additional amount which is equal to your benefit amount but limited to a maximum of R100 000. And another great benefit that this policy gives you is that there is also an Immediate Expenses benefit which is paid within 48 hours of receipt of the claim documents and the claim being valid. This means that a portion of your Life Cover benefits will be paid to you within 48 hours and will be limited to a maximum of R100 000. Premium Waiver will pay 6 premiums of the policy if the principal life assured passes away and if there is a spouse also covered (the policy must be active for 6 months).  Premium Waiver benefit on this product - should you pass away, the remaining spouse on the policy will remain covered for a further 6 months and no premiums will be payable. Within this 6-month period, your spouse may make the decision to either continue the policy (by becoming the new policyholder and premium payer) or end the policy.

<Client name>, please note that this policy covers a principal life insured and one spouse only, both of whom must be aged between 18 and 65 at the start of the policy. This policy does not stop once you reach the age of 65 and you will enjoy cover on this policy for as long as all premiums are paid.                                                                                                     Minimum              Maximum                                      Cease age
Policyholder          18 last birthday 65 last birthday             None
Spouse                 18 last birthday 65 last birthday             None
Was the client advised of correct premiums

The waiting period from the policy start date is 6 months (with 6 premiums needing to be paid) for natural causes of death before a claim will be paid. Accidental death is covered immediately upon receipt of your first premium.The policy does not cover any claims for suicide for the first 24 months. To qualify for the Premium Waiver benefit to be paid, the policy must have been active for 6 months, with at least 6 premiums being paid.

Please confirm if this policy is being purchased with the intention to replace or cancel another existing policy? Obtain a “yes” or “no” If you are replacing any insurance product, this may come with risks, for example new waiting period or exclusions or different benefits or lives assured. Please ensure that you read through the terms and conditions before cancelling your other product. If you are purchasing this Standard Bank Flexible Life Plan by replacing a Standard Bank Flexible Funeral Plan (i.e. the Standard Bank Flexible Funeral Plan policy was cancelled and the Standard Bank Flexible Life Plan was issued not more than one (1) month after such cancellation), Standard Bank will assess any claim as if cover was continuous and any new waiting period will only apply to cover in excess of the replaced policy or if the life insured was not previously covered. If the Flexible Life Plan has a higher benefit amount than the previous policy, the full 6-month Waiting Period will apply to the difference between the two benefit amounts. Please note that the Flexible Life Plan does not cover children, parents or extended family members (like is done on the Standard Bank Flexible Funeral plans)

Claims are paid once all relevant documentation has been received and your claim has been approved. The documents required to claim are mentioned in the terms and conditions. You may claim at any Standard Bank branch or by contacting our claims contact center - 0860 123 999 (Option 3). Your claim must be submitted within 12 months from the date of death of the insured person.

There are no medical examinations required to incept this policy – all you need to do is answer three simple health related questions to see if you qualify to be covered.  This product allows you to insure one spouse. Would you like to insure a spouse? If customer answers "NO", skip to next section. 
Have you ever been refused long-term life insurance cover or offered cover on special terms? Yes or No?

Have you been diagnosed with or had symptoms of any of the following? NB to the consultant: Please read out all the medical conditions below to the customer.
• Tuberculosis (TB),
• any form of cancer or tumours,
• any heart, liver, lung, or blood disorder,
• HIV,
• stroke or other brain disorder (such as epilepsy),
• raised blood sugar or diabetes,
• high blood pressure or high cholesterol (where you are not following treatment advised by your doctor),
• mental health conditions such as chronic depression, bipolar disorder, chronic anxiety, alcoholism and the use of recreational drugs on a regular basis (including having gone for rehabilitation due to drug or alcohol addiction). Yes or No?

Mr/s ___________, can you confirm that you have answered these questions yourself and honestly. Please note that in the event of a claim, the information provided may be verified. If the information is found to be inaccurate, this may affect your claim.

We do not cover accidental death as a result of any insured person’s direct involvement in any illegal or criminal acts. NO Benefits will be paid during the waiting period, except for accidental death. Should any life assured pass away due to natural causes during the waiting period, SBIB will refund the premiums paid for that particular life assured.

Mr/Mrs _______________. In the event of your death, the benefit will be paid to your nominated beneficiaries on this policy. 
The nominated beneficiary is the person who you would want the money to be paid to in the event of your death. This may be amended at a later stage by contacting our customer services department. however, we encourage you to provide us with details as soon as possible to avoid delays when there is a claim.
You may have a total of up to 5 nominated beneficiaries and you can allocate a percentage of the benefit amount that you would like them to receive.
Accurate capturing of the information provided which includes personal details and product related information.
Market Conduct Table.category: Accuracy Capturing Service Request on Core System

Market Conduct Table.phrase: Notes to reference the call: Make notes regarding call backs made to client, referral feedback, information that cannot be amended or captured elsewhere. Did you add accurate notes on Sapphire (1st/2nd call etc). Spouse second call.

Did the consultant acknowledge and addressed the client appropriately? All calls should be conducted in our business language (English) unless customer request to switch. Ask permission to speak in customers preferred language if struggling with English.

Never speak faster or slower than the client, always match their pace
If you are struggling to hear the customer let him know rather than trying to assume what he is saying. Remember it is important for the customer to hear and understand everything you are saying.
Have you ever been hospitalised for longer than 7 days in the last 3 years, excluding hospitalisation for childbirth? Yes or No?

Product Risk Table.phrase: We understand that sometimes there will be no money to pay your insurance premium. Your policy will not immediately lapse if you are unable to pay a premium. When you miss a premium (for example your debit order came back as unpaid because of insufficient funds) we will notify you of such missed premium and you will have 15 days to pay this premium before we reduce your benefit amount.

Process Table.phrase: Mr/s_____________ to ensure that I am speaking to the right person and to protect the security of your information. Please provide/confirm your ID number?
Please confirm or add emails address
Adhering to laid down business process & rules as per product specifications:1.No 3rd party premium payers allowed. The Principal Life Assured must be the premium payer
2.Spouse Life Assured must be available to answer the medical disclosure questions via telephone – or spouse cover cannot be issued
3.Up to 5 beneficiaries are allowed per policy
4. The customer does not need to have a Standard Bank account in order to take out this product

5. The maximum Life Cover benefit per Life Assured across all Flexible Life Plan policies will further be limited to R500 000. Where the maximum benefit has been paid, no further benefits will be paid
6.Processed debit date from inception 3-5 working day

7.The spouse does not have to consent to POPI – as the policy is issued in the main insured’s name and by speaking to the spouse the spouse is being made aware that their spouse is taking out a policy for them.  Only the main insured can nominate beneficiaries, and the beneficiaries are sanction screened at claims stage. If the Spouse passes away – the benefit amount is paid to the main insured. The Spouses information if not processes or sanction screened on a daily basis.
Was system error escalated to IT and incident number provided?

Customer Experience Table.phrase: Give reason why client will be placed on hold. Apologies for delays or hold period.
Actively paying attention to the customer throughout the call and comprehending what the customer is saying
Always be available at all times to speak to client (Inbound or Outbound)
Ensure you utilize the customer’s name minimum 3 times in a call (beginning of the call, middle and when you close the call)
Accountability, resolution etc. Do as promised to the client (e'g Call back client as promised)
Appropriately used empathy for the customer’s situation and acknowledged the customers highs and lows.
Ask client if they can be further assisted before putting the phone down.
Do not be rude to client or get irritated.

POSITIONING OF THE SURVEY TO CUSTOMERS“Thank you for your call we would really appreciate a few minutes of your time to complete a quick survey. There are only 3 questions on the survey regarding your experience on this call.” May I proceed to transfer you to the survey?
Display high professional standard of conduct (Eating, chewing, speaking over the customer) Speak clearly, use simple words and phrases, don’t use overly complex vocabulary. Avoid slang.

Did the consultant end the call appropriately or shared a positive statement?Congratulation on the purchase of your Standard Bank Flexible Life Plan. Please remember to ensure that you have RXXXX in your bank account available for the debit order to be debited on XX/XX. We want to activate your policy as soon as possible for you to start enjoying the benefits of this policy. Have a great day <Client name.
